title: France grapples with Francophone Africa's growing push for sovereignty
summary: While he succeeded in winning over part of the continent at the start of his first term, President Emmanuel Macron has since seen many former French colonies turn their backs on him, as he was unable to turn his promises into action.

title: Morocco migrant boat wreck left 70 missing, says Mali government
summary: A vessel heading for Spain carrying around 80 migrants sank on December 19, with only 11 survivors rescued out of the 70 missing, the Mali government said on Thursday. '25 young Malians unfortunately identified among the victims.'

title: Syria authorities arrest official behind Saydnaya death penalties: NGO
summary: Mohammed Kanjo Hassan – who headed Syria's military field court from 2011 to 2014 and was promoted to chief of military justice nationwide – was arrested in the coastal Tartus province, a stronghold of Assad's clan, along with 20 members of his entourage, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.

title: 'People often talk about Donald Trump rallies as carnivals. That's absolutely right'
summary: The carnivalesque traditions of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance staged an inverted social world to remind everyone of the need for the world to be right-side up. In a 'Le Monde' op-ed, American historian Robert Zaretsky analyzes how these rites of reversal shed light on the US's current political life.

title: Israel strikes airport and military targets in Yemen amid rising hostilities with Houthis
summary: The strikes targeting the airport, military facilities and power stations followed rising hostilities between Israel and the Houthis, part of Iran's 'axis of resistance' alliance against Israel.

title: In India, the pristine island of Great Nicobar threatened by a mega-development project
summary: The miraculously protected island in the Bay of Bengal is home to an isolated, 'uncontacted' tribe, the Shompen, and a rare endemic biodiversity. Narendra Modi envisions turning it into a global shipping hub.

title: Turkey's economy faces a dilemma over the return of Syrian refugees
summary: In Turkey, several hundred thousand Syrians work in agriculture, textiles, construction, hospitality and craftsmanship, sectors where they play a crucial role.

title: Baltic Sea cable hit by outage, prompting investigation into vessel from Russia
summary: The Estlink-2 power went down just after noon on Wednesday. There has been concern about undersea cables in the wake of damage to two data cables in November and Nord Stream gas pipeline.

title: Microplastic pollution found to be widespread in French soils
summary: For the first time, the French Agency for Ecological Transition has measured the concentration of plastic microparticles in French soil. Prairies, vineyards, orchards or field crops, no type of soil is spared.

title: India's former PM Manmohan Singh dies at age 92
summary: Manmohan Singh, who held office from 2004 to 2014, is credited with having overseen an economic boom in Asia's fourth-largest economy in his first term.

title: France's PM Bayrou to visit cyclone-hit Mayotte Sunday and Monday
summary: François Bayrou has faced criticism for attending a town hall meeting in his home city of Pau, where he is the mayor, while Mayotte grappled with the aftermath of the deadly cyclone.

title: Ukraine and its allies claim North Korean troops are fighting on the frontline in Russia
summary: Russia is deploying major resources to take back the entire region of Kursk, which Ukraine invaded in early August. Some 1,000 North Koreans have been sent to the area to assist 50,000 Russian soldiers, according to Western intelligence.

title: Syria's new government negotiates the disbanding of armed groups
summary: The leader of the HTS group, Ahmad al-Sharaa, wants to put a stop to undisciplined factions and set up a real national army.

title: How tsunami science has advanced, 20 years after the catastrophe in Indonesia
summary: The disaster that claimed 230,000 lives in Southeast Asia in December 2004 triggered an international awareness campaign. In two decades, models have been significantly refined and warning systems developed.

title: Life as a parent, my 2024 retrospective
summary: Le Monde's Clara Georges delves into the yearly summaries made by the apps that have been monitoring her daily life.

title: Over a hundred migrants in distress rescued trying to cross English Channel
summary: Over the course of Christmas Day, 12 rescue operations were staged along the coast of northern France, including of a boat experiencing engine trouble.

title: A convent and a hotel. Step inside Le Corbusier's La Tourette convent near Lyon
summary: Somewhere between radical simplicity and brutalist aesthetics, this concrete monolith designed by the Swiss architect in the 1950s is both the Dominican friars' living quarters and an unusual, spartan hotel. This gigantic listed building offers full-board accommodation, with meals in the cafeteria and overnight stays in monk's cells.

title: In South Korea, divorced mothers live under strain
summary: In a society that remains highly unequal, divorced mothers must fight to balance their professional and personal lives. They often choose to start their own businesses to have more control, but this doesn't protect them from prejudice or exploitation.

title: How Madrid became a laboratory for ultraliberalism at odds with the rest of Spain
summary: Spain's fast-growing capital region is stepping up tax cuts and deregulation to boost its attractiveness – to the point of irritating Pedro Sanchez's Socialist government and other regions.

title: North Korean soldier captured in Russia-Ukraine war, says South Korean intelligence
summary: Seoul's Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS) also said Monday that more than 1,000 North Korean soldiers have been killed or wounded.

title: In the US, conservatives revive the battle over abortion access
summary: Texas has announced legal action against a New York doctor, accusing her of prescribing a Texas woman the drugs used to terminate pregnancies up to 10 weeks, in violation of state law. The complaint is expected to run up against New York state law. But other cases of this type could follow.

title: South Korea​n Lawmakers impeach ​acting leader Han Duck-soo
summary: Han has been the caretaker president after Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached by the assembly over his short-lived imposition of martial law earlier this month.

title: Moscow suspected of mistakenly shooting down Azerbaijani plane
summary: The Christmas Day air crash in Kazakhstan was probably caused by an error on the part of Russian anti-aircraft defenses tracking Ukrainian drones. Moscow attributes the disaster to a collision with birds.

title: Book: Yves Saint- Laurent, a life of dogs
summary: Moujik, Hazel... the French couturier had many dogs throughout his life. A new book by Martin Bethenod is dedicated to this essential companionship.

title: NATO to 'enhance military presence' in Baltic Sea after suspected sabotage of underwater cable
summary: Separately, Estonia began patrols to protect an undersea cable supplying electricity from Finland following the damage caused on Christmas Day.

title: The death of Manmohan Singh, former Indian prime minister, eminent economist and reformer
summary: A member of the Congress party, this Sikh led the country from 2004 to 2014. The architect of many economic reforms, he also opened up his country to the world, bringing it closer to the West. His record was tarnished by rising inequality and corruption. He died on Thursday at the age of 92.

title: Yemen rebels claim missile attack on Tel Aviv airport
summary: The claim came a day after Israel pounded Sanaa's international airport.

title: German president dissolves parliament, confirms February 23 election date
summary: Olaf Scholz's government was brought down last month over disagreements on the country's economy.

title: New Caledonia's pro-independence government is overthrown for being too soft on French government
summary: Disagreement over the reconstruction of the archipelago, whose economy was brought down by the May 13 insurrection, has got the better of Louis Mapou. His detractors want to introduce a 'combative government' for negotiations with Paris.
